column1: length ball on off, and he covers his off stumps, before tapping a shot to point with the bat's open face. Off the mark, straightaway
length ball, just outside off, and blocked off the back foot after shuffling across
appeal for lbw but not given. Full on off, and angling inwards. Tries to whip it off his legs, but the ball hits his back leg. Rolls away to square leg
length ball on leg stump, and clipped off the back foot to square leg
length ball on leg, but jags further into his pads. Worked off his pads to the vacant square-leg region
length ball, just outside off, and tapped off the back foot to cover. Played with soft hands
full and wide outside off, and KL Rahul chooses not to chase after it. Could've driven, but opts to shoulder his arms
length ball on off, but angling into his body. Tries to nudge it away to square leg, but leading edge takes the ball to point instead!
full on middle, and drifting into his pads. Flicked off his pads to deep backward square. Short runs around the boundary to intercept
length ball on off, and angling away from Dhawan. Throws his hands at this, trying to punch square with the bat's open face. Finds point though
back of a length on middle, and Dhawan takes a couple of steps forward to meet the ball. Punched to cover point, but can't pierce the gap
length ball on leg stump, and arrives near Dhawan's gut. Tries to muscle a flat-batted shot to the leg side, but it flies off the bat's splice. Rolls back to Richardson. Tidy over
slapped! Length ball on middle, and going across the right-hander. Throws his hands at this, and cuts a shot past point
back of a length outside leg stump, and he rides the bounce to nudge a shot away to fine leg for a walking single
whipped! Length ball angling into his body, but Dhawan skips down the wicket, and muscles a leg-side shot over the infield. A couple of bounces, and into the cow-corner boundary
back of a length on off, and Dhawan uses his feet again. Punched to cover on this occasion
back of a length, slightly slower from Behrendorff. Worked off his hips to deep square leg for one
length ball on middle, and angling into Dhawan. Nudged off his pads - with soft hands - to the leg side, and off they go for a single
full-ish on middle, and he mistimes a clip to square leg. Ball rolls away to the leg side as Dhawan calls for the single
offcutter on leg stump, and Dhawan shapes up to pull over the leg side. Ball stays low, and it hits him near the abdomen! Ouch.
extra short on middle, and the ball balloons over Dhawan's head. He tries to ramp it over the keeper, but can't get the connection. Umpire spreads his arms wide

slower ball, just outside leg, and Dhawan looks to clip this fine. But he can't get the connection once again, and the ball rolls into the keeper's gloves. Coulter-Nile isn't pleased, the ball nearly brushed leg stump there
offcutter on leg stump, and he inside-edges a defensive shot onto his pads. Ball dribbles away to the off side as Rahul tells Dhawan to run
check-pulled! Back of a length on off, but the ball's angling in. Rahul swivels on one foot, and lifts a controlled shot over the infielder at short fine-leg
short and wide, and Rahul tries to slap a cut in front of square. Hits the bat's inside-half and rolls back to Coulter-Nile
back of a length, wide outside off, and steered down to third man for a jogging single
length ball, wide outside off but coming inwards. Defended off the back foot to short cover
back of a length just outside off, and he shuffles onto the back foot to defend. Ball dribbles to the off side as Rahul scampers across for one
length ball angling across, and punched to cover. D'Arcy Short dives to his left, and parries the ball to Maxwell, who cleans up the fielding effort
top-edged! But for six! Short on middle, and Rahul took his eyes off the ball, but the pulled-shot finds a meaty top edge, and flies into the stands beyond fine leg
full and wide outside off, and lifted into the stands! Width offered, and Rahul prods forward before confidently driving over the infield. Someone in the crowd makes a mess of the catch too
back of a length just outside off, and smartly steered to point off the back foot. He'll keep strike
back of a length on middle, and he rides the bounce, before turning this away to square leg with gentle hands. They scamper across for one
length ball on middle, and Dhawan shuffles across to the off side - exposing all three stumps - but he mistimes an attempted paddle-shot to short fine leg
smacked! But straight to deep square leg. Back of a length on middle, and he clatters a pull to the leg side
what a shot! Full on middle, right near his toes, and he nonchalantly flicks this over deep midwicket! All the work done by Rahul's bottom-hand. Proper whippage
pulled over backward square! Rahul was almost expecting that given the last full ball went for six. Stays on the back foot, meets the ball near his chest, and hooks a shot for another half-a-dozen

Rahul's down! Back of a length on middle, and he looks to defend, but the ball holds it's line, and hits Rahul near his abdomen. He falls forward, facepalming the pitch, but his feet are inside the crease. 53 for 0 after the Powerplay
flighted full outside off, and the ball skids further away. Drives away from his body, but no real power there. Stopped at cover point
length ball on middle, but another skidder going down the leg side. Allows the ball to reach him, before flicking fine past the keeper's left
full on middle, and he comes down the ground to meet the ball. Drives a shot right into the pitch, and the ball goes back to Zampa. Palms the ball away to mid-off
full on middle, and Dhawan comes down the ground to muscle an on-drive to wide long-on
length ball, just outside off, and turning away. Defended off the back foot to cover
full just outside off, and pushed to deep extra cover for a walking single

ramped straight to third man! Back of a length outside off, and Rahul opens his shoulders to play a cheeky shot over third man. Done in by the lack of pace (119 kph) and the uppercut lobs in the air. No mistake from Richardson running in
full and wide outside off, and Kohli drives away from his body. Outside-edge past first slip to third man
length ball on off, and coming into his body. Nudged off the back foot to square leg
back of a length on middle, and he tries to muscle a pulled shot. Mistimed along the ground to deep midwicket
length ball, too wide outside off, but Kohli chases after it. Cut square to the fielder manning the boundary on the off side

offcutter, full outside leg stump. Dhawan tries to whip this behind square, but ball hits his front leg. No appeal for lbw, since the ball didn't pitch on the stumps. Ball rolls away to the leg side as the batsmen pinch a single
full on middle, and pushed off the front foot to cover for a quick single
length ball, wide outside off, and turning further away. Kohli tries to defend, but toe-ends the shot to the off side
length ball on middle, and skidding in. Worked off the back foot to midwicket, but they can't pinch the run
length ball on middle, and he opens his stance to flat-bat a pulled shot to long-on
length ball on leg, cramping Dhawan for space. Mistimes a pulled shot past short fine-leg to the man in the deep

slider on middle, and Kohli pulls along the ground to deep midwicket. Kohli completes the single quickly, but pushes Dhawan for the second. Sharp throw from Jhye Richardson and it's a direct hit! But Kohli's dive saves him. That was closer than he would've liked. Big roar from the crowd
play and a miss! Back of a length outside off, and he goes for the pull. Ball whizzes under his bat

full outside off, and he opens the bat's face to drive over cover. Stoinis, though, runs in from the boundary and dives forward to take a stunning catch. But it's been taken so close to the ground, that the umpires want to have a second look. Not sure which team will be happier with the wicket. Replays suggest that the ball did hit the ground, but his fingers may have been under it by then. Soft signal was out so this should be interesting. What does TV umpire Menon feel? Dhawan's gone if the TV umpire's unsure because of the soft signal. And the TV umpire says 'out'. But, we'll never know whether it was a conclusive decision or he stuck with the on-field umpire's call. India lose their second, and Dhawan's tiring innings comes to close
full on off, and guided off the front foot to third man for a single
length ball, wide outside off, and he presses forward to punch. Stopped by cover
length ball, angling in, and nudged to the leg side. Gets off the mark
length ball on middle, and he guides this from near his body with the bat's open face to point. They jog across for one
long-hop to start, but it slows down off the track and Kohli drags a pull from wide outside off to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, cut crisply to backward point
and again, a nice-looking, firmly struck cut, straight to backward point
ripping turn this time, similar line and length to the previous two balls. Pant is unsure whether to cut or leave, and he ends up not connecting

gone, the pressure's told on Pant! Tosses this one up enticingly, a fair way outside off stump, and Pant goes for the big heave and loses his shape. Wasn't quite full enough for him to control perfectly, and it turns and skews up in the air for Jhye Richardson to take an outstanding catch, sprinting to his left from long-off and throwing himself horizontally at the ball
very full on off stump, jabbed to midwicket
shortish, close to off stump, hurries through and Kohli pulls along the ground to long-on

ooh, that skids through, and is past Dhoni and leads to a hesitant appeal for a stumping. Up it goes to the third umpire. Quickish ball outside off, dips a little shorter than Dhoni expects as he walks forward to try and play it into the covers. Goes with the angle, past his inside edge, but he does extremely well, almost does a full split, to stretch his back leg back and juuust land it past the line
flighted a little slower outside off, slapped to cover
a bit of flight again, this time he flat-bats down to long-off

not that short at all, but Kohli is onto the back foot in a flash to create a boundary opportunity. Not that wide either, but the footwork has made this a cuttable ball, past the left hand of the diving backward point fielder
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
flattish, back of a length, angling across the stumps from over the wicket. Rocks back to pull to the right of long-on
slowed down, pitching just outside leg. Dhoni goes down on one knee for the leg-side heave, plays too early and misses and is hit on the back leg
another delivery along a similar trajectory, flighted and inviting Dhoni to go for another slog-sweep. Dhoni watches it better this time, and the ball soars way over the midwicket boundary
flatter now, on middle stump, goes back to whip it but can't get it past midwicket
short googly outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
flat again, straightens towards middle and leg, goes deep in his crease to pull to deep square leg
length ball outside off, carved up and over the covers, to the right of the sweeper. Not quite middled - he may have wanted to hit it straighter than where it landed up
back of a length on off stump, pulled to long leg, off the inner half of the bat. Kohli seems to be going a little too hard at some of his shots today
back of a length on off stump, opens up a touch and flat-bats to extra-cover
fuller now, angling into middle and off, and Dhoni hammers it away, clearing his front leg and simply bashing it down the ground, between the bowler and mid-off
back of a length, angling into leg stump, worked away to long leg
back of a length on off stump, carved away to deep point
wide, shortish slower ball, reaches out and slaps towards third man
short and wide, and Dhoni puts it away with ease, gets up on his toes and cracks it away to the point boundary, in the air to the right of the fielder at backward point
back of a length on middle and off, punched to long-off
length ball on off stump, and Kohli shuffles away from the line to make a bit of room, and lofts it cleanly, into the gap and over the boundary, to the left of long-off

a bit wider, Kohli has to reach out for it. Goes hard at the ball, a kind of front-foot uppercut, and third man, running to his right and diving, can't quite get to it before it bounces, but he can keep it from going to the boundary. Zampa the fielder

ooh, that was pretty much in the slot, and Kohli isn't too pleased with himself. Fullish, a bit of width outside off, and Kohli swings a little too early and misses his lofted off drive. May have been the slower ball, mind
slower ball, back of a length, angling into the body. Dhoni swivels to pull it off his hip towards long leg
slower ball, full and fairly wide of off. Dhoni drags it along the ground to long-on, bringing his bottom hand into play
and yet, he can hit shots like this. Another slower ball, on a length and finishing on about off stump. Kohli just brings his wrists into play and flicks it all the way over the midwicket boundary
and another! Similar length, wider this time, and Kohli frees his arms to deposit it high over the extra-cover boundary

That's a Mahendra Singh Kohli shot alright! A couple of steps down the pitch to the off-stump length ball, and he brings his wrists into play once more to whip it high over the forward square leg boundary
stump-high full-toss on off stump, clipped down to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle and off, pulled to deep midwicket
this is a good, containing length for this pitch. Flat and hurrying through at just under stump height. Goes deep in his crease to whip to long-on
flat again, but much fuller this time, right up near Kohli's back leg. Has to drag his front leg away from the line to try and flick it, and misses. Hits his back leg, but easily missing leg stump
flat length ball outside off, goes on the back foot to chop it to backward point
flat again, on middle and leg, goes back and punches to deep midwicket with a straight bat to bring up his fifty
again that hard-to-attack length, on off stump. Dhoni makes a bit of room to cut, a few yards to the right of backward point
dangled up slow on leg stump, slog-swept on the bounce to deep midwicket
floated up and right in Dhoni's slot on off stump. Clears his front leg and gives it the full bottom-hand treatment to deposit it beyond the wide long-on boundary
flatter, more leg-stumpish. Looks to pull but not quite short enough, drags it to the left of short fine leg off the inner half of his bat
fullish and quickish on off stump, makes some room and flat-bats it hard to long-off

monstered. Flights it again, lands it in MS's hitting arc just outside off stump, and he simply clears his front leg and hoicks it high over the midwicket boundary, that's landing in row L on any ground in the world
what a costly decision this has been, giving Short the 18th over. Shortish, on off stump, makes a bit of room and slaps it away to the point boundary
full slower ball outside off, quite wide. Goes hard at it, looking to hit over cover, and misses

excellent wide yorker, almost. Maybe a harsh call from Anil Chaudhary too - only marginally past the tramline, but Kohli had shuffled across in premeditation too. Reached out for it but couldn't connect

bam. Doesn't get his attempted wide yorker wide enough or full enough, and Kohli takes a step across his stumps to get a little closer and swing through the line to clear the long-off boundary comfortably
low full-toss outside off, driven to long-off
slower ball, back of a length, close to off stump, flat-batted down to long-on
low full-toss wide of off stump, great hands from Kohli to play a sliced drive into the gap between backward point and sweeper cover. Sharp running too to pick up two
wow. Full outside off and Kohli steps across once again and frees his arms through a hard, flat hit straight back over the umpire's head - not that far over - and run away to the boundary in a flash
wide yorker gone horribly wrong. Dhoni doesn't even attempt to play it, and Handscomb throws himself across the turf to prevent it from running away for even more runs
another wide outside off stump. Slower short ball, and Dhoni has to reach for it to try and cut it. Can't connect

miscued, and Dhoni won't get his fifty. Cummins bowls a cross-seam ball, just short of a good length, on about off stump, and Dhoni, aiming towards long-on, slices it instead and long-off takes a simple catch walking a few steps forward off the rope
slower bouncer, gets up to head height over off stump. Kohli shapes to hook and has to adjust to the lack of pace. Helps it along the ground through wide mid-on
back of a length on off stump and DK doesn't middle it, but he won't care. Goes for the cleared-front-leg pull and drags it off the inside half of his bat, into the gap to the left of short fine leg
slower bouncer outside off, and DK waits, waits some more, and uppercuts firmly, up and over short third man, to the right of the fielder

quick length ball, angling into DK's legs to try and deny him room. Clears his front leg and looks to whip over the leg side, misses, but they sneak a quick leg-bye even as Cummins closes down the ball in his follow-through

down the track, Cummins tries to bowl a slower ball out of his reach, well outside off, but doesn't quite succeed. He only allows Kohli to free his arms, and he does so gleefully to launch a crisp hit over the long-off boundary
inswing first up, but drilled through the covers! Full on off, and coming into Short, but he times this well to the wide long-off boundary
length ball, much better line. Once again jagging inwards, and Short inside-edges a flick right onto his pads. Ball rolls away to the off side as they scamper across for a single
back of a length, just outside off, and Stoinis carefully defends off the back foot
length ball, on off stump, and this pace will not bother Stoinis. Swivels, and pulls in front of square to the midwicket boundary
length ball, slightly outside off stump, and fended off the back foot to cover
full and wide outside off, and he presses forward to drive. Struck well, but intercepted at cover point
length ball on leg, and angling across Short. He tiptoes and steers a back-foot tap to point
length ball, wide outside off but coming inwards. Punched firmly through the infield, but Krunal chases after it, and parries the ball back to his partner. Solid throw from the deep to MSD
back of a length outside off, and he rides the bounce to punch. Off the bat's top-half, and it rolls away to mid off
back of a length outside off, and the ball doesn't bounce as much as Stoinis expected it to. Tiptoes to punch, but toe-ends the shot to mid-off this time
full outside off, and Stoinis is deceived by the slower ball (116kph). Looks to drive through the covers, but splices the shot to midwicket instead
back of a length outside off, and the ball jags away slightly. Cut away - but not well - to point for a single
full just outside off stump, and driven away from his body to mid off. Mistimed on this occasion
He answers the captain's Kaul! Back of a length on off, and Stoinis looks to pull. But ball sneaks under his bat, and clips the top of off stump. Another failure from Stoinis, the opener
full outside off, and a bit of outswing from Kaul. Maxi Finch looks to drive away from his body, but the ball whizzes past his outside edge
length ball, wide outside off, and he cuts this into the ground. Ball takes an awkward bounce as it's goes over point, but Rahul manages to get a hand to it, and slow the ball's pace down
misfield! From Rahul. Full ball outside off, and the square drive seems to go straight to point. But ball goes through him, and he's forced to give the ball a chase
full on middle, and he presses forward to defend. Ball rolls away to cover
back of a length on middle, and Short shapes up to pull. Mistimes a flat-batted shot to mid-on
length ball on middle, and angling away from Short. Cut square, but can't thread the gap
back of a length on middle, and nudged off the back foot to the sweeper-fielder on the leg side. A walking single for Short
length ball on middle, and worked off his hips to the leg side. Placed behind square, and the fielder at deep midwicket is too far away
length ball just outside off. Finch offers the bat's straight face to defend, and taps it back to Shankar

sliced in the air! And Dhawan completes the catch with a thigh-five to boot. Finch's poor run continues. Back of a length on off, and he looks to pull over midwicket, but the ball doesn't rise as much, and he lobs the catch to cover.
appeal for lbw but Bumrah withdraws after realising there's an inside edge. Length ball on leg, and Short misses the swipe towards midwicket
full on middle, but Short chooses to go onto the back foot. Tapped to the off side, but finds mid off
full on middle, and he takes a step backward again, deep into his crease. Pushed to mid-off
full outside off, but Maxwell shuffles towards the ball's line, before punching to mid-off for a quick single
full on leg stump, and clipped to deep square leg for a walking single
top-edged, but goes all the way! Short ball that's soaring over Maxwell's head, but he attempts to pull, and gets enough connection to clear the boundary behind Dhoni
full on middle, and swinging slightly away. Driven away from his body, but mistimed to cover's left
full on off, and crunched! Just a bit of width, and he picks this early. Smacks it past cover's left for a much-needed boundary. Just four balls left in the Powerplay
back of a length on middle, and he raises his front leg, before pulling along the ground to deep backward square
back of a length on off, and he works this - off his hips - to the gap near square leg. Just a single on offer though
full toss wide outside off, and he slaps this freebie to the extra-cover boundary for four. No movement of the feet, all the power coming from his quick hands. Short's not missing those
length ball on off, and angling inwards. Worked off his legs to the sweeper-fielder manning the cow-corner region
back of the hand slower ball, full on leg stump. Muscled through mid-on's left to Chahal at cow corner
length ball on middle, and paddled over square leg! Delivery angling in, and he helps the ball over the infielder
another slower ball, length delivery outside off. He mistimes a square cut to the off side
length ball, wide outside off, and he tries to steer this shot between point and gully. Krunal runs to his left, and dives sideways to stop the ball from sneaking through
short on leg, and he stays on the back foot. Raises his front leg, and then helps a pulled-shot over the square-leg umpire's head
slower ball, full on leg, and whipped off his toes to deep midwicket
back of a length, quickish, on off stump, worked away through midwicket

shot! That wasn't all that short, and it was pitcing on middle stump and turning away a reasonable deal, but Maxwell rocks back and puts his bottom wrist to full use for a whip-pull that easily beats deep midwicket to his left
fuller, on the pads. Misses the flick, or maybe gets an edge on it, and the ball rolls towards short fine leg off the outside of his front pad
nice idea, but the execution goes slightly wrong. The quicker slider, angled away from Short and forcing him to reach out to drive. Just ends up angling it too wide
googly on a length, worked away wide of midwicket
looks to bowl that wide line he's bowled with success to Maxwell, but ends up bowling it too wide. Left alone
back of a length on the pads, nudged away through square leg, and doesn't put too much weight on the shot, so they can scamper two
wide length ball, rocks back to slap it to sweeper cover
flat, back of a length, angling into the stumps, makes room and punches to extra-cover
not that short, angling into middle stump, rocks back and pulls to the left of deep midwicket. Kept slightly low but he watched it well and crouched a little while playing the shot

flat, slanted across the left-hander, no turn back in. Lovely shot from Short, hangs back and chops it away to the left of the diving backward point fielder. Not the most athletic-looking effort from Bumrah
back of a length on off stump, makes room and punches to long-off
fired into the pads, clipped into the backward square leg region
length ball on off stump, and that's easily put away, just frees his arms and hits it flat and hard, back over the bowler's head
fairly full, on the pads, clipped down to long-on

gone, that's an excellent... wait, that's just slipped through Rishabh Pant's grasp at backward point. Short outside off and Short cuts uppishly. Pant dives forward and to his right, and the ball bursts through his hands about a foot off the ground. A dropped chance, relatively straightforward
shot! A bit of flight outside off, and Maxwell has lofted that effortlessly over the wide long-off boundary
looks to clip this through the leg side, closes his face early and sends a leading edge rolling into the point region
fairly full outside off and Short goes for the big loft. Doesn't connect cleanly, and luckily for him it goes flat and bounces well short of long-off
fired into the pads, clipped away through midwicket
flat, back of a length, keeps going with the angle towards the batsman. Clears his front leg to pull but it isn't short enough and sneaks under to hit thigh pad
fuller now, clipped quietly to long-on
flat, back of a length, turning from off to middle, stays back and whips through square leg

and Maxwell still finds the boundary. Floats this full and wide, seemingly secure with long-off and extra-cover back, but Maxwell is able to flat-bat this much straighter, bringing his bottom hand into play, and find the gap to the right of long-off
slower this time, on leg stump. Looks to flick and pops a leading edge just out of reach of Krunal, leaping to his left with left arm outstretched
length ball on off stump, stays back and slaps it to long-off

and he strikes first ball! Slower ball, angled across the stumps from over the wicket. Short clears his front leg and looks to hit it over the on side with a cross bat, and ends up slicing it high in the air, to Rahul waiting under it in the covers
short outside off, stops on the batsman a little and he chops it down to point
slower ball, but it's misdirected, on the pads, and Maxwell still finds enough pace to use and glance it away fine, a long way to the right of long leg who's stationed quite square
another slower ball, loopy and descending onto Maxwell's front foot. Clipped to long leg
back of a length outside off, stabbed away into the cover point region. Doesn't come on for the cut and he ends up meeting it well in front of his body
slower ball gone wrong, ends up whanging it waaay outside off stump

wham. He's bowled a lot of slower balls, and Maxwell was well prepared. Back of a length, on off stump, and he's back and across in a flash and has all the time in the world to swat this away over the midwicket boundary. That makes it 13 off this over, and 38 off Shankar's four. I guess India will take it, especially since he got the wicket of Short.
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
back of a length, cramping Maxwell with the angle from round the wicket. Worked off the hip into the backward square leg region
flat, back of a length, angling into leg stump. Punched down to long-on

flat length ball on off stump. Goes back almost by rote, and he doesn't have the room to actually punch it where he wants - to long-on. Ends up playing a defensive push into the on side and Krunal cuts off the single
back of a length again, worked to deep midwicket to bring up his second fifty of the series. Excellent innings
again, back of a length, stump-to-stump, angled in from wide of the crease, no turn, and forcing the batsman to go leg-side. Clipped away to deep midwicket
a couple of steps down the pitch and Chahal fires it a little shorter and wider. Driven to extra-cover
down the track and this time Chahal bowls it at his pads, flat and quick. Clipped away quietly to deep midwicket
flat slider on leg stump. Makes a lot of room and opens his bat face to squeeze a single to the right of backward point

down the track once again comes Handscomb, and that's a lovely crisp hit. Ends up getting one right in his slot for the inside-out chip over wide long-off, hits it well enough to nearly carry all the way
length ball on middle and off, swept away to the right of deep backward square leg
back of a length slider on leg stump, makes room to punch to deep extra cover
nice change of pace. He usually goes quick, quick, quick, and Maxwell is too early on his slog-sweep, misses and the ball hits him high on the thigh
wide outside off, back of a length, Maxwell reaches out to cut and misses
back of a length on middle and leg, pulled to deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, pulled in the air, on the bounce to deep backward square leg
flat length ball angling into off stump, and too quick for the reverse-swat. Bit of an lbw shout, but India don't review. May have straightened just enough to miss off stump

whoa, that's the biggest hit of this innings. A big front-foot stride to a back-of-a-length ball close to off stump, and he generates incredible power through his hips to wallop that waaay over long-off
flat and back of a length again, and Maxwell goes too early into the pull, drags it along the ground to deep backward square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, nudged into the vacant midwicket region and they scamper two while the fielder sprints in off the boundary

full, just outside leg. Was looking to cramp him by attacking his pads, but he's marginally missed his line, and Maxwell gets down on one knee at great speed and swivels through a sweep that easily clears the backward square leg boundary

Chahal goes to his wide-outside-off line, and Maxwell's response is emphatic, a reverse-sweep off incredible power and bat-speed, whacked over the point boundary. The key was how quickly he created a wide base with his footwork
full on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
down the track and Chahal floats a full one outside off. Pushed out to deep extra-cover for one
flat, fairly wide outside off. Hurries through to beat Maxwell's attempted cut

shortish outside off, jabbed to the left of backward point. Krunal dives, stops it, and throws to the bowler's end. Bumrah is in front of the stumps, he leaves it, the ball misses the stumps, and they sneak an overthrow
full, plenty of width, a rare free hit from Bumrah, and you don't bowl those to Maxwell in this mood. Drives it up and over cover, finishing with a high left elbow
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed down to long-off
length ball on off stump, opens his bat face and steers it down to third man

that's a great shot. Not the most attractive shot he's played, and it's muscled rather than timed, but he's gone so deep in his crease to convert a slightly back-of-a-length slower delivery into a short ball and he swivels to beat the diving square leg fielder
very full outside off, Maxwell slices it flat and hard towards deep point
short ball just outside off, maybe the knuckle ball, and Maxwell swivels too early into his pull and gets hit on his back
dismissive. That's smacked the top corner of the sightscreen, on the full. Length ball outside off, and he just clears his front leg and smacks it through the line
in the blockhole on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg
